intro: Waltheria acuminata, commonly known as the slender bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slight pubescence. Waltheria acuminata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands.
